Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel

Class KernelEstimatorTransferEntropyMultiVariate

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel.KernelEstimatorMultiVariate
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel.KernelEstimatorTransferEntropyMultiVariate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class KernelEstimatorTransferEntropyMultiVariate
extends KernelEstimatorMultiVariate

    Kernel estimator for use with the transfer entropy on multivariate source and destination.

    Extends KernelEstimatorMultiVariate, using the super class to manage the history of the destination variable, and adds the next state and source on top of this. Any calls to the super class methods will only function on the joint history.

    TODO More thoroughly check the Javadocs here

    References:

    • H. Kantz and T. Schreiber, "Nonlinear Time Series Analysis" (Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, MA, 1997).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    KernelEstimatorMultiVariate, KernelEstimatorTransferEntropy

        destPastVectors - is the joint vector of the past k states of the joint variables. Each vector has values x_c,t: [x_0,0; x_0,0; .. ; x_d,0; x_0,1 .. ] i.e. it puts all values for a given time step in at once.

      • getCount

        public TransferEntropyKernelCounts getCount​(double[] destPast,
                                            double[] destNextObs,
                                            double[] sourceObs,
                                            int observationTimeStep)
        Compute the required counts for Transfer Entropy using kernel estimation on the destination's past. Use callbacks to check if the joint counts need to be incremented. If observationTimeStep < 0, then no dynamic correlation exclusion will be attempted
        Parameters:
        destPast -
        destNextObs -
        sourceObs -
        observationTimeStep -

      • correlatedPointAddedCallback

        protected void correlatedPointAddedCallback​(int correlatedTimeStep)
        A callback for where a correlated point is found at correlatedTimeStep in the destination's past. Now check whether we need to increment the joint counts.
        Overrides:
        correlatedPointAddedCallback in class KernelEstimatorMultiVariate

      • correlatedPointRemovedCallback

        protected void correlatedPointRemovedCallback​(int removedCorrelatedTimeStep)
        A callback for where a correlated point is removed due to dynamic correlated exclusion. The removal is for the point at correlatedTimeStep in the destination's past. Now check whether we need to decrement the joint counts.
        Overrides:
        correlatedPointRemovedCallback in class KernelEstimatorMultiVariate
